gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: The basic idea is to write a program to analyze a shotgun’s shot pattern.
sentences.chinese: 基本的想法是寫一個程序分析散彈槍的射擊模式。

sentences.english: Actually, shotguns are very good home-defense weapons.
sentences.chinese: 其實，散彈槍都是很好的家庭防禦武器。

sentences.english: Random Submachine Gun, Shotgun, and Pistol at beginning of round.
sentences.chinese: 隨機槍械組合，包含衝鋒槍，散彈槍和手槍。

sentences.english: The shotgun is a better anti-zombie strategy than cremation.
sentences.chinese: 相比火，散彈槍是更好的打殭屍武器。

sentences.english: Police are again using shotguns loaded with beanbags rubber bullets to disperse the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 警察再次使用裝滿橡膠彈的散彈槍來驅散人羣。

sentences.english: We incorporate a loaded shotgun in our home defense planning.
sentences.chinese: 我們納入散彈槍在我們的家防衛計劃。

sentences.english: Rationing:Kill an enemy with your shotgun while you're out of minigun ammo.
sentences.chinese: 當你機槍沒子彈時，用散彈槍解決敵人。

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
